name: Amy Cook
content: Amy Cook - Computer Science - The University of Memphis Skip to main content SearchX Safety & Security Prospective Students Current Students Parents & Family Alumni Veterans Faculty & Staff People Take Action Follow Us Online FacebookLinkedIn Home Computer Science People Faculty Pages Amy Cook Amy Cook Associate Professor and Undergraduate Coordinator Phone 901.678.4128 Email ascook@memphis.edu Fax 901.678.1506 Office Dunn Hall 113 Office Hours Call for hours Degree: PhD, Human-Computer Interaction, Carnegie Mellon University, 2019 Research Interests:Human-computer interaction Personal Website:https://amyshannoncook.com/ Google Scholar Dr. Cook joined the Computer Science Department in Fall 2019. Prior to joining, she completed her PhD in Human-Computer Interaction at Carnegie Mellon University. Dr. Cook's research focuses on understanding how students interact, and how technology can impact student learning. Her work includes projects on building systems for improving peer feedback, implementing pedagogical strategies for improving group work, and designing games. She often conducts studies in computer science and game design classes. At the University of Memphis, Dr. Cook teaches courses on Human Computer Interaction.
